thread.title: ESPN to broadcast morning football show before North Dakota State's homecoming football game
thread.title_full: ESPN to broadcast morning football show before North Dakota State's homecoming football game

title: ESPN to broadcast morning football show before North Dakota State's homecoming football game
text:
ESPN to broadcast morning football show before North Dakota State's homecoming football game THE ASSOCIATED PRESS First Posted: October 05, 2015 - 12:10 pmLast Updated: October 05, 2015 - 12:10 pm We also have more stories about: (click the phrases to see a list) 
Subjects: 
North Dakota (276) 
FARGO, North Dakota â€” ESPN is setting up shop in Fargo for a third straight year. 
The network plans to broadcast its "SportsCenter on the Road" program Saturday morning at the Fargodome, ahead of North Dakota State's homecoming football game against Northern Iowa. 
The show features a mobile production facility on a bus that allows for reporting at remote locations. The show runs from 6 to 8 a.m. Central time. 
ESPN brought its popular three-hour "College GameDay" show to downtown Fargo in 2013 and 2014. NDSU athletic director Matt Larsen says the school has a good working relationship with NDSU and is excited for another show in front of a national TV audience. 
"SportsCenter on the Road" has aired from Notre Dame, Michigan, Boston College, Clemson and St. John's this year.
